discussion.p: <cfenv>, as specified in , requires fexcept_t to be an integer type:

<cfenv> was initially added to the (first) Technical Report on C++ Library Extensions via and then integrated into the C++ Working Draft N2009 in Berlin (April, 2006).
However, C99 does not actually require that fexcept_t is an integer type, it only requires:

blockquote.p: The type fexcept_t represents the floating-point status flags collectively, including any status the implementation associates with the flags.

discussion.p: Relaxing this requirement should not cause conforming C++ implementations to no longer be conforming. In fact, this should enable conforming C implementations to become conforming C++ implementations without an ABI break. The only incompatibility I foresee is where a user's program is initializing a std::fexcept_t with an integer value, which would become invalid on some C++ implementations (but not those that were previously conforming).
